body: I'm doing a pass.
`ResourceAllocationEventImpl` and `ResourceRecoverEventImpl` seem to be identical. Maybe we can share much code between them?
@afchung I've done an initial pass.

Why are there changes in the `.Client` project for this?

Also, can't this code be part of the `.Driver` project? Or does it have to be a new one because it is C++? If it is the latter: Maybe `DriverLauncher` or such is a better name? `ClrDriver` sounds as if this was somehow the CLR-based driver, which in fact is in `.Driver`.
@nachocano I did a pass.

Client project is modified in preparation for the next stage. 
DriverLauncher could be another name with the caveat that we would only be launching the driver on windows systems. 
We could try to use Driver project by making it an exe, but then it will not be possible to have multiple PRs, we would have to do it all in one PR.
Beysim and I just spoke about the naming thing and came up with `Org.Apache.REEF.Driver.Launcher` as the project and namespace name.
@markusweimer Updated. Thanks!

@johnyangk Overall this looks good. I left some comments. I think `FirstFitSchedulingPolicy` implementation can be cleaned up a bit.
I will test and merge.

Java tests pass, C# tests do not:

```
Test method Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests.ClassHierarchy.TestClassHierarchyRoundTrip.TestInjectNonStaticLocalArgClass threw exception: 

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
    at Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests.ClassHierarchy.TestClassHierarchy.TestInjectNonStaticLocalArgClass() in TestClassHierarchy.cs: line 264
```

And:

```
Test method Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests.ClassHierarchy.TestClassHierarchyRoundTrip.TestSimpleConstructors threw exception: 

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
    at Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests.ClassHierarchy.TestClassHierarchy.TestSimpleConstructors() in TestClassHierarchy.cs: line 133
```

And:

```
Test method Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests.ClassHierarchy.TestClassHierarchyRoundTrip.TestTimer threw exception: 

System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
    at Org.Apache.REEF.Tang.Tests.ClassHierarchy.TestClassHierarchy.TestTimer() in TestClassHierarchy.cs: line 142
```
I've address the comment. Thanks.
@afchung Did you test this on YARN? If so, I will merge.
